_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Executive Summary



This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:

- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program - Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5

- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) - Title 40 CFR ?68

- California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR ?5189

- Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR ?1910.119



Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.



This program is intended to be a "living document". As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Sun Pacific Reedley has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 



1.1 Sun Pacific Reedley, Risk and Process Safety Management Program



This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Sun Pacific Reedley has updated/ their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following processes which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 



Process Name                 | Process Chemical                | Process Quantity(lbs.)

Ammonia Refrigeration          Anhydrous Ammonia                 39,000



Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses, and physical property damage.



Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. We have: 

1. Prepared a unified program based on the PSM regulation to

meet CalARP and RMP obligations as well

2. Organized the program so that it meshes closely with general business practices

3. Utilized PSMWriter software to ensure that all necessary employees have access to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)



The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures, and practices that will help our employees and neighbors protect themselves.



1.2 Process Description



Sun Pacific Reedley operates a commercial cold storage facility in Reedley, CA. The facility has an ammonia refrigeration system that provides refrigeration capacity to the following:



(9) Cold Rooms

(3) Hallways

(1) Loading Dock



The cold rooms, hallways and loading docks are equipped with air cooling evaporators and accumulators as required for flooded operation..



Most control valve groups are located in the center hall (catwalk) to provide easy access. The refrigeration machinery is contained within two refrigeration machinery rooms (north and south) or directly above each machinery room. A partial list of system components includes:



Machinery Room

(4) Screw Compressors

(4) Oil Separators

(4) Oil Coolers

(1) Main Suction Accumulator

(2) Liquid Transfer Vessel

(1) Thermosyphon Vessel

(1) High Pressure Receiver

(4) Evaporative Condensers



Cold Rooms

(38) Bunker Coils

(6) Ceiling-suspended Evaporators

(25) Accumulators



Loading Dock

(3) Ceiling-suspended Units

(3) Accumulators



Hallways

(7) Ceiling-suspended Units

(7) Accumulators



The flooded system operates as follows: high pressure liquid from the high pressure receiver is piped to each area, where it passes through an expansion valve into low temperature and pressure accumulator. From the accumulator, low pressure liquid is circulated through the evaporator coils. As heat is absorbed, the liquid ammonia vaporizes to form low temperature and pressure gas which is returned to the accumulator vessel. The suction gas is returned from the accumulators through a suction re

turn line to each main suction accumulator.  From the main suction accumulator, ammonia is piped to the suction inlet on the compressors. The high pressure discharge from the compressors is sent to water-cooled evaporative condensers where the high pressure gas ammonia is cooled, liquefied and returned to the thermosyphon vessel and then to the high pressure receiver.



The system contains numerous safety devices including sensors which stop the compressors if temperatures or pressures exceed or drop below established limits, and pressure relief valves which vent to the atmosphere if the pressure in the system exceeds their set point.



The ammonia system at Sun Pacific Reedley consists of vessels, equipment, and valves which are interconnected by piping.  As such, the refrigeration system at Sun Pacific Reedley is treated as a single process.



1.3 General Accident Release & Chemical Specific Prevention Steps



1.3.1 General 



We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.



Sun Pacific Reedley has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hard copy binders. 



1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia



The ammonia refrigeration process at the Sun Pacific Reedley facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. The ammonia process contains a total charge of approximately 39,000 lbs. It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia lea

k.



Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration process and keep an active log book of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. 



1.4 Five Year Accident History



There have been no accidental releases of ammonia at Sun Pacific Reedley in the last 5 years.



1.5 Emergency Action and Response Plan



Sun Pacific Reedley's emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:

- California "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 8 CCR ?3220

- Federal "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 29 CFR ?1910.38



Strategically, we will respond "minimally" to a release. Under this plan we will call emergency personnel and evacuate the facility. All response activities would be done in coordination with the Local Fire Department and their Hazardous Materials Response Team. 



Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.



1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety



Sun Pacific Reedley has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, Sun Pacific Reedley continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.

By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Sun Pacific Reedley's ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Sun Pacific Reedley's management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.



Sun Pacific Reedley has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are ente

red into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.



In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Sun Pacific Reedley has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation.

For the future, Sun Pacific Reedley now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a "living document". It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Sun Pacific Reedley employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program Sun Pacific Reedley will continue to maintain overall plant worker and public safety.
